description: Character profile generation - creates folder structure and template files for new characters

usage_documentation.purpose: Generate character profile template structure and interactively populate it. Creates the folder structure, template files, and interactively populates them with character information.
usage_documentation.key_concept: Character profiles are generated FROM templates, not templates themselves. The template contains parameterized placeholders that get filled in during generation, creating a profile file with actual character data.

generation_process.description: Three-step process for creating a new character profile

step1_folder_creation.creates: Base folder, context/ subfolder, and episodes/ subfolder in behaviors/character/characters/{character-name}/
step1_folder_creation.validates: Checks character name uniqueness (folder must not already exist)

step2_template_copying.result: Copied file contains parameterized placeholders ready to be filled

step3_interactive_population.process: Tool prompts user for each placeholder in the template
placeholders: narrative style examples (4 mode combinations: combat/non-combat × speak/act)
step3_interactive_population.result: After filling all placeholders, the file becomes a generated character data file (no longer a template)

template_structure.description: Character profile template includes sections for:
sections: Multiple Identities (optional - for characters with costumed/secret identities)
Dialogue Style (including optional Style Reference Examples)
Narrative Style Examples (4 mode combinations - combat/non-combat × speak/act)
Character-Specific Keywords (optional - combat and non-combat keywords for context detection, defaults available)

generated_profile.description: The generated character profile contains actual character data (not placeholders)
generated_profile.usage: Generated profile is used by character chat commands to inject data into prompt templates
generated_profile.content: All placeholders are replaced with actual text content provided during interactive population

character_name_validation.description: Character names must meet validation requirements
requirements: Alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores only
Must be unique (folder must not already exist)
Name is used for folder and file naming

optional_templates.description: Additional optional templates may be copied if they exist

do: DO create folder structure before copying template
DO copy template from behaviors/character/behaviors/generate/ to behaviors/character/characters/{character-name}/
DO replace all parameterized placeholders with actual content
DO validate all parameters are filled before completion
DO preserve template structure while replacing placeholders
DO allow keywords to be left empty (defaults will be used)
dont: DON'T modify source template in behaviors/character/behaviors/generate/
DON'T leave parameterized placeholders unfilled (except keywords which can use defaults)
DON'T create character profiles without using template
DON'T create separate keywords files (keywords are part of the profile)
DON'T use character names that already exist

mcp_tool.name: character_profile_generate
mcp_tool.description: Generate character profile template structure and interactively populate it

character_name.description: Character name used for folder and file naming
